In the present study, global population density data in the targeted future years (i.e., 2020, 2030, 2040, and 2050) were estimated based on the two following steps. First, the ratios of the population size in a target year to that in 2015 were calculated for the 70 countries and regions listed in Table 1. Second, global population density in the target year was estimated by multiplying the population density of a given country or region in 2015 by the corresponding population growth ratio. The global population projections from the Wittgenstein Centre Data Explorer Version 1.2 considered the fertility, mortality, and migration of population for each country. In the present study, therefore, the estimated data on future population density also contain information related to country-level population movement.
